column4: Hey everyone, I have a question... I'm downloading the Ubuntu AMD64 disc now, and the problem I had with the Gentoo install is that it wouldn't support my SATA devices during install.  Will I also run into this problem with the Ubuntu install?  Bot my HDD and my DVD RAM drive are SATA.
it should, unless you rmotherboard has a funny chipset
I'm familiar with Gentoo -- will any of the changes be difficult for me to get used to, do you think?
I haven't used Linux for over 2 years (been in Iraq) but...
there is no root account, minor difference
That's a great idea... never thought of it like that
Seems a whole lot more user friendly.
that's the idea behind most ubuntu features.
I apologize for the ignorance, but I am totally new to this.  Ubuntu is based upon Debian, right?  So it uses apt-get?
And, my favorite feature about Gentoo was Emerge, because it got all the dependencies for me.  Will Ubuntu be able to do that too?
yes, apt manages dependencies very well, and you can find most software you could want in repositories.
youll just have to try it.  There's really not much explaining needed if youve used linux before.  I switched from SuSE and had no problems figuring anything out.
